questions.text: A mother comes with her 5-year-old child in whom a murmur has been found incidentally during a primary checkup. The child was delivered at home but has completed all age-appropriate vaccinations. He has been referred to you for screening for congenital heart disease. The mother will not have cyanosis as a complaint in her child in which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

VSD It is cyanotic heart disease.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Tetralogy of Fallot Option: B. -TAPVC Option: D.-Transposition of Great Vessels

questions.text: On a chest X-ray of a patient, you find pulmonary plethora. Which of the following conditions is ruled out?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tetralogy of Fallot Pulmonary plethora on CXR indicates increased pulmonary blood flow. Cyanotic heart diseases with increased pulmonary blood flow

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. TAPVC Option: C. VSD is a cyanotic congenital heart disease associated with increased pulmonary blood flow. Option: D. Transposition of Great Vessels Truncus arteriosus Hence, TOF is the answer.

questions.text: A mother with no previous antenatal checkups delivers an infant with mongoloid slant of eyes, single palmar crease, and sandal gap between the great toe and other toes. Anomalies of development of which part of the interventricular septum may commonly be found in such an infant?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Conotruncal septum The clinical picture of an infant without any antenatal screening with mongoloid slant, single palmar crease, and sandal gap suggests a diagnosis of Down’s syndrome . Down’s syndrome is associated with various neural crest migration defects. Since the conotruncal part of the ventricular septum is derived from neural crest cells, it is most likely to be affected by Down syndrome.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A and B. - Muscular part and membranous part of the septum are usually not affected in Down’s syndrome. Option: D. - Septum secundum is part of interatrial and not interventricular septum

questions.text: Which of the following is not matched correctly with its pathophysiological cause?

options.label: A
options.text: Truncus arteriosus - Due to non-formation of the spiral septum

options.label: B
options.text: Transposition of Great Vessels - Due to the spiral nature of the conotruncal septum

options.label: C
options.text: ASD -Due to a defect in atrial septal development

options.label: D
options.text: VSD - Due to a defect in ventricular septal development

questions.correct_answer: B. Transposition of Great Vessels - Due to the spiral nature of the conotruncal septum
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Transposition of Great Vessels - Due to the spiral nature of the conotruncal septum If the development of the conotruncal septum is in a non-spiral manner, then the aorta gets connected to the RV and pulmonary artery to the LV, leading to the Transposition of great vessels . There, the non-spiral nature of the septum leads to this defect.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. - Normally, the outflow tracts of the ventricles are initially a single cavity, which is then divided into the root of the aorta and pulmonary artery respectively by a spiral conotruncal septum . If this septum does not develop, it causes the persistence of the single common outflow tract -Truncus arteriosus ) Option: C.- Due to a defect in atrial septal development Option: D.- Due to a defect in ventricular septal development

questions.text: A refugee mother presents to you with her 6-year-old child with a history suggestive of cyanotic spells, saying he has some heart condition diagnosed at previous checkups. She does not have any documents of his previous checkups, saying that she lost the documents while migrating. The only evidence she has is a chest X-ray, which shows a boot-shaped heart. Which of the following anomalies may not be seen in this child?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Supravalvular pulmonary stenosis A history of cyanotic spells combined with a CXR showing a boot-shaped heart is suggestive of TOF.

Highyeild:

Tetralogy of Fallot - Features PROVE that you have Tetralogy of Fallot P ulmonary stenosis R ight ventricular hypertrophy O veriding aorta V entricular Septal Defect

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - The components of TOF are- Subvalvular (not supravalvular) pulmonary stenosis Option: D. - RVH Option: B. - VSD Option: C. - Aorta overriding the VSD

questions.text: A known case of TOF whose parents had refused surgery presents to you with sudden blueness of body since morning when he started crying after being denied pizza for breakfast. Which of the following statements about his management is NOT correct?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Salbutamol nebulization This clinical presentation is characteristic of a Tet spell/Cyanotic spell in TOF . Beta-agonists like salbutamol will aggravate the shunt and are hence contraindicated. Tet spells occur when there is an excess of catecholamines, causing infundibular spasms, and aggravating the pulmonary stenosis. This in turn aggravates the right to left shunt in the VSD, causing cyanosis.

Highyeild:

Management of Tet spells/Cyanotic spell Knee chest position – To increase left heart pressure, hence decreasing the shunt Oxygen Phenylephrine – Increases left heart pressure Beta-blockers like esmolol – Decrease right heart pressure Bicarbonates if there is severe acidosis Beta-agonists like salbutamol will aggravate the shunt and are hence contraindicated

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A.- Knee chest position – To increase left heart pressure, hence decreasing the shunt. Option: B.- Phenylephrine – Increases left heart pressure Option: C.- Oxygen

questions.text: All babies who have tetralogy of Fallot need corrective surgery. Without treatment, the patient might not grow and develop properly. Which of the following shunts used in the treatment of ToF is incorrectly matched?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
